qas.question: What model id used to calculate energy levels of hydrogen?
What attracts planets and celestial items?
What does the electromagnetic force attract to one another?

context: The energy levels of hydrogen can be calculated fairly accurately using the <a0_0>Bohr model<a0_0/> of the atom, which conceptualizes the electron as "orbiting" the proton in analogy to the Earth's orbit of the Sun. However, the electromagnetic force attracts <a2_0>electrons and protons<a2_0/> to one another, while planets and celestial objects are attracted to each other by <a1_0>gravity<a1_0/>. Because of the discretization of angular momentum postulated in early quantum mechanics by Bohr, the electron in the Bohr model can only occupy certain allowed distances from the proton, and therefore only certain allowed energies.
